articles.headline: Hollywood Executive Ron Meyer Leaves NBCUniversal After Secret Settlement
articles.snippet: A storied career that took him from teenage messenger to studio chief ends in a sudden resignation.
articles.abstract: A storied career that took him from teenage messenger to studio chief ends in a sudden resignation.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — For four decades, even as other moguls came and went, Ron Meyer remained a Hollywood power player of the first order, a combination of amiable mayor and string-pulling godfather. But his career came to an apparent end on Tuesday in a way that has become numbingly routine in the entertainment business: He was ensnared in a tawdry scandal.
articles.byline: By Brooks Barnes and Nicole Sperling

articles.headline: What Is QAnon, the Viral Pro-Trump Conspiracy Theory?
articles.snippet: Explaining the “big tent conspiracy theory” that falsely claims that President Trump is facing down a shadowy cabal of Democratic pedophiles.
articles.abstract: Explaining the “big tent conspiracy theory” that falsely claims that President Trump is facing down a shadowy cabal of Democratic pedophiles.
articles.lead_paragraph: If you’re spending a lot of time online these days — and thanks to the pandemic, many of us are — you’ve probably heard of QAnon, the sprawling internet conspiracy theory that has taken hold among some of President Trump’s supporters.

articles.headline: ‘This Market Is Nuts’: S&P 500 Hits Record, Defying Economic Devastation
articles.snippet: Investors have cast the nearly relentless drumbeat of bad news aside to focus on any signs that the worst of the coronavirus pandemic might be over.
articles.abstract: Investors have cast the nearly relentless drumbeat of bad news aside to focus on any signs that the worst of the coronavirus pandemic might be over.
articles.lead_paragraph: Widespread economic devastation, severe unemployment and a grim prognosis for recovery have not stopped the stock market’s exuberance. And on Tuesday, that undying optimism propelled the market to a new high, pushing it past a milestone reached only six months ago, when the coronavirus was just beginning its harrowing journey across the United States.

articles.headline: Much Changed World, Same Joe Biden Seeking to Undo What Trump Has Done
articles.snippet: Night 2 of the Democratic National Convention focused on how much work awaits the next president, and all the reasons Democrats think voters should trust Mr. Biden with the job.
articles.abstract: Night 2 of the Democratic National Convention focused on how much work awaits the next president, and all the reasons Democrats think voters should trust Mr. Biden with the job.
articles.lead_paragraph: WILMINGTON, Del. — The Tuesday night speaking lineup for the Democratic National Convention was always intended as a muscular contrast on foreign policy and diplomatic integrity, presented to viewers under the evening’s unsubtle theme: “Leadership Matters.”
articles.byline: By Katie Glueck, Matt Flegenheimer and David E. Sanger

articles.headline: Democrats Nominate Biden for President, Delivering Long-Sought Prize
articles.snippet: In a virtual roll call showcasing its diversity, the party rewarded Joe Biden with the nomination he has pursued intermittently since 1988. The long-awaited victory is a triumph of personal and political endurance.
articles.abstract: In a virtual roll call showcasing its diversity, the party rewarded Joe Biden with the nomination he has pursued intermittently since 1988. The long-awaited victory is a triumph of personal and political endurance.
articles.lead_paragraph: Democrats formally nominated Joseph R. Biden Jr. for the presidency on Tuesday night, anointing him as their standard-bearer against President Trump with an extraordinary virtual roll call vote that showcased the cultural diversity of their coalition and exposed a generational gulf that is increasingly defining the party.
articles.byline: By Alexander Burns and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: Apple Reaches $2 Trillion, Punctuating Big Tech’s Grip
articles.snippet: Apple is the first U.S. company to hit that value, a staggering ascent that began in the pandemic.
articles.abstract: Apple is the first U.S. company to hit that value, a staggering ascent that began in the pandemic.
articles.lead_paragraph: It took Apple 42 years to reach $1 trillion in value. It took it just two more years to get to $2 trillion.
